name: SIGMORPHON 2016 Shared Task: Paradigm Completion
body:
### Welcome to GitHub Pages.
The first SIGMORPHON shared task is 
morphological paradigm completion. The goal
is fill out a morphological paradigm, 
a nominal or verbal inflection table in this task,
given some incomplete representation of whole paradigm,
e.g., the lemma or a partial (potentially noisy) set of
slots of the paradigm. This area of computational
morphology has received a flurry of attention recently
in the NLP literature (Dreyer and Eisner (2009), Dreyer and Eisner (2011),
Durett an DeNero (2013), Hulden et al. (2014), Nicolai and Kondrak (2015), _inter alia_).

### Task 1 -- Lemma to Full Paradigm

### Task 2 -- Partial Paradigm Completion

### Bibliography

Mans Hulden, Markus Forsberg, Malin Ahlberg. Semi-supervised learning of morphological paradigms and lexicons. EACL 2014: 569-578

Greg Durrett, John DeNero.
Supervised Learning of Complete Morphological Paradigms. HLT-NAACL 2013: 1185-1195

Markus Dreyer, Jason Eisner. Discovering Morphological Paradigms from Plain Text Using a Dirichlet Process Mixture Model. EMNLP 2011: 616-627

Markus Dreyer, Jason Eisner. Graphical Models over Multiple Strings. EMNLP 2009: 101-110


### Authors and Contributors
ryan.cotterell@gmail.com
